title: Favorite Fruit
content:
okay something different from the worst & favorite vegetable polls, this time you are voting for your favorite fruit, as always it's simple vote for your favorite & we will see which fruit gets the most votes[url=http://www.ironmaiden.com][img]http://i11.photobucket.com/albums/a199/rorie1983/ironmaiden.jpg[/img][/url]

title: Re: Favorite Fruit
content:
I voted banana.
I don't eat enough fruit, but if I do, bananas are nice, just easy to eat for lazy people (me).
Actually I recently ate an apple again, and it was surprisingly good, even if it does take a bit more time and a washing of hands if you don't want juice all over your keyboard/something else.
So, I started eating apples some more.

Only recently (a year ago I suppose) I rediscovered apple juice.
I remembered it was really sour, but I tried it again for some reason, and it was actually a lot sweeter than I remembered, and I liked it.
I haven't drunk just de pomme much (even more) recently though...

Yes, very interesting all that, but this very thread is off-topic, so I'm allowed! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Favorite Fruit
content:
i like bananas too, but you are lucky cuz recently cyclone larry hit northern queensland wiping out 80 percent of australia banana crop, which means that australians will pay more until the crop regrows

i searched the net & found this story
[url=http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/common/story_page/0,5744,18547959%255E1702,00.html]here[/url]

we could be paying high as AU$6 a kilo, the geelong food relief centre where i volunteer has already had to stop buying bananas until the price goes down[url=http://www.ironmaiden.com][img]http://i11.photobucket.com/albums/a199/rorie1983/ironmaiden.jpg[/img][/url]

title: Re: ...
content: A banana is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banana]technically a herb[/url] and the discussion of kiwifruit reminds me of [img]http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/kiwi.gif[/img].

title: Re: ...
content: Are you sure the banana is an herb? I didn't read the article thoroughly, but it sounds like you didn't read the second sentence.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: ...
content: The term 'fruit' in the second sentence is just a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fruit]standard term[/url] for the 'container' holding a plant's seeds.  Pretty much every plant has fruit, but not all of them are edible.  A banana is classified as a herb because that's the family that its parent plant belongs to, just like a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomato]tomato is technically a berry[/url], even though we usually consider it a vegetable.

title: Re: ...
content:
"Aren't tomatoes fruits?"

That's what I thought until I read the Wikipedia article - I guess they're the fruits of a berry plant, just like bananas are the fruits of a herb plant.

"in keen dreams, if the place is full of veggies, why are there apples and tomatoes"

Good point - there are grapes too, and squashes, which are another one of those 'vegetables that are technically fruits.'

title: Re: ...
content:
*sigh*

Did you not heed the words of the great [HA!] Najawa?

Do you have ANY idea how much sugar there is in fruit? Apples alone have an avergae of 1.5 teaspoons free sugar per apple, and watermellon almost three times that.

Fruit are not the healthy natural things your parents ate, they've been bred and picked to be bigger, juicier, softer and sweeter.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

My three favourite fruits: Grape, apple, orange, pineapple.

[edit] Shutup. I added pineapple as an afterthought.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:">

I'm eating grapes now, as it happens. Generally I consume an apple for breakfast. I only really like Pink Lady and Royal Gala, sometimes others if they're sweet enough. Granny Smith and Golden Delicious are too hard/bitter and soft/weird, respectively, and most other red ones don't have much taste to them.

I don't really eat many oranges any more, though a couple of years ago I was in the habit of eating one for breakfast... I just found them to be too much hassle in the end. So I just drink a lot of orange juice--only pure, organic stuff though. The stuff you get from supermarket shelves and such is really horrible once you've tasted real orange juice.

I don't really eat pineapple by itself either, since large quantities acidify my tongue. Canned stuff doesn't, but I don't really like eating processed fruit--though it's pretty much a necessity when it comes to pizza, of which I consume a fair bit these days. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society
